DOCNAME: CASE OF ACUN AND YUMAK  v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG expropriated a plot of land belonging to the applicants . A committee of experts assessed the value of the plot of land and the relevant amount was paid to the applicants when the expropriation took place .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants filed an action with ORG of First - instance requesting additional compensation . On DATE the First - instance court awarded them additional compensation plus interest at the statutory rate .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of ORG of First - instance , finding that the amount awarded was too high .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG awarded the applicants additional compensation of CARDINAL NORP Liras ( GPE ) ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) plus interest at the statutory rate applicable at the date of the court ’s decision , running from DATE , the date on which the title deed to the land had been transferred . The judgment of the court became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the authorities paid the applicants the sum of TRL CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( approximately EUR CARDINAL ) , including interest .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice are set out in the Aka v. GPE judgment of DATE ( Reports of Judgments and Decisions CARDINAL-VI , pp . DATE , § § DATE ) .
